field.name: HALT
field.description: Halt\n Starts and stops DSPI transfers

field.name: SMPL_PT
field.description:
Sample Point
 Controls when the DSPI master samples SIN in Modified Transfer Format.
 This is the number of clocks cycle between SCK edge and SIN sample.
 This field is valid only when CPHA bit in CTARn[CPHA] is 0

field.name: CLR_RXF
field.description: Flushes the RX FIFO\n Writing a 1 clears the RX Counter

field.name: CLR_TXF
field.description: Clear TX FIFO\n Writing a 1 clear the Tx FIFO counter

field.name: DIS_RXF
field.description: Disable Receive FIFO

field.name: DIS_TXF
field.description: Disable Transmit FIFO

field.name: MDIS
field.description: Module Disable\n Allows the clock to be stopped to the non-memory mapped logic in the DSPI effectively putting the DSPI in a software-controlled power-saving state

field.name: DOZE
field.description: Doze Enable\n Controls the module operation in dose mode

field.name: PCSIS
field.description: Peripheral Chip Select x Inactive State\n Sets the inactive level of the PCS signals

field.name: ROOE
field.description: Receive FIFO Overflow Overwrite Enable\n Controls whether the Rx FIFO discards new data when overflowing

field.name: PCSSE
field.description: Peripheral Chip Select Strobe Enable

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: PCS5/PCSS is used as Chip Select signal

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: PCS5/PCSS is used as active-low PCS Strobe signal

field.name: MTFE
field.description: Modified Timing Format Enable

field.name: FRZ
field.description: Freeze\n Control whether the module is disabled in Debug mode

field.name: DCONF
field.description: Configuration

field.name: CONT_SCKE
field.description: Continuous SCK Enable

field.name: MSTR
field.description: Master/Slave Mode Select

field.name: SPI_TCNT
field.description: Transfer Counter

register.name: CTAR%s
register.description: Clock and Transfer Attributes Register (In Master Mode)

field.name: BR
field.description: Baud Rate Scaler

field.name: DT
field.description: Delay after Transfer Scaler\n Selects the scaler for the delay between the negation of the PCS signal at the end of a frame\n and the assertion of PCS at the beginning of the next frame

field.name: ASC
field.description: After SCK Delay Scaler

field.name: CSSCK
field.description: PCS to SCK Delay Scaler

field.name: PBR
field.description: Baud Rate Prescaler

field.name: PDT
field.description: Delay after Transfer Prescaler\n Selects the Prescaler for the delay between the negation of the PCS signal at the end of a frame\n and the assertion of PCS at the beginning of the next frame

field.name: PASC
field.description: After SCK Delay Prescaler

field.name: PCSSCK
field.description: PCS to SCK Delay Prescaler

field.name: LSBFE
field.description: LSB First\n Select MSB or LSB first mode

field.name: MODE
field.description: Clock Phase and Polarity

field.name: CPHA
field.description: Clock phase\n Determine when output data changes and input data is captured relative to the clock

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Data captured on leading edge\t- Data changes on following edge

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Data changes on the leading edge\t - Data captured on following edge

field.name: CPOL
field.description: Clock polarity\n Defines inactive state of the CLK

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Inactive is low\t- Leading edge is rising (idles low)

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Inactive is high\t- Leading edge is falling (idles high)

field.name: FMSZ
field.description: Frame Size\n The number of bits transferred per frame is equal to the FMSZ field value plus 1.\n The minimum valid FMSZ field value is 3

field.name: DBR
field.description: Double Baud Rate\n Allows the baud rate to be doubled but the duty cycle depends on the Baud Rate Prescaler

register.name: CTAR_SLAVE
register.description: Clock and Transfer Attributes Register (In Slave Mode)

field.name: MODE
field.description: Clock Phase and Polarity

field.name: CPHA
field.description: Clock Phase\n Determine when output data changes and input data is captured relative to the clock

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Data captured on leading edge\t- Data changes on following edge

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Data changes on the leading edge\t - Data captured on following edge

field.name: CPOL
field.description: Clock Polarity\n Defines inactive state of the CLK

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Inactive is low\t- Leading edge is rising (idles low)

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Inactive is high\t- Leading edge is falling (idles high)

field.name: FMSZ
field.description: Frame Size\n The number of bits transferred per frame is equal to the FMSZ field value plus 1.\n The minimum valid FMSZ field value is 3

field.name: POPNXTPTR
field.description: Pop Next Pointer\n Contains a pointer to the RX FIFO entry to be returned when the POPR is read.\n The POPNXTPTR is updated when the POPR is read

field.name: RXCTR
field.description:
RX FIFO Counter
 Indicates the number of entries in the RX FIFO.
 The RXCTR is decremented every time the POPR is read.
 The RXCTR is incremented every time data is transferred from the shift register to the RX FIFO

field.name: TXNXTPTR
field.description: Transmit Next Pointer\n Indicates which TX FIFO entry is transmitted during the next transfer.\n The TXNXTPTR field is updated every time SPI data is transferred from the TX FIFO to the shift register

field.name: TXCTR
field.description:
TX FIFO Counter
 Indicates the number of valid entries in the TX FIFO.
 The TXCTR is incremented every time the PUSHR is written.
 The TXCTR is decremented every time an SPI command is executed and the SPI data is transferred to the shift register

field.name: RFDF
field.description:
Receive FIFO Drain Flag
 Provides a method for the DSPI to request that entries be removed from the RX FIFO.
 The bit is set while the RX FIFO is not empty.
 The RFDF bit can be cleared by writing 1

field.name: RFOF
field.description:
Receive FIFO Overflow Flag
 Indicates an overflow condition in the RX FIFO.
 The field is set when the RX FIFO and shift register are full and a transfer is initiated.
 The bit remains set until it is cleared by writing a 1 to it

field.name: TFFF
field.description: Transmit FIFO Fill Flag

field.name: TFUF
field.description: Transmit FIFO Underflow Flag

field.name: EOQF
field.description: End of Queue Flag\n Indicates if EOQ is set in the executing command

field.name: TXRXS
field.description: TX and RX Status\n Indicates the status of transmit and receive operations

field.name: TCF
field.description: Transfer Complete Flag

register.name: RSER
register.description: DMA/Interrupt Request Select and Enable Register

field.name: RFDF_DIRS
field.description: Receive FIFO Drain DMA or Interrupt Request Select\n Selects between generating a DMA request or an interrupt request

field.name: RFDF_RE
field.description: Receive FIFO Drain Request Enable\n Enables the RFDF flag in the SR to generate a request.\n The RFDF_DIRS bit selects between generating an interrupt request or a DMA request

field.name: RFOF_RE
field.description: Receive FIFO Overflow Request Enable\n Enables the RFOF flag in the SR to generate an interrupt request

field.name: TFFF_DIRS
field.description: Transmit FIFO Fill DMA or Interrupt Request Select\n Selects between generating a DMA request or an interrupt request

field.name: TFFF_RE
field.description: Transmit FIFO Fill Request Enable\n Enables the TFFF flag in the SR to generate a request. The TFFF_DIRS bit selects between generating an interrupt request or a DMA request

field.name: TFUF_RE
field.description: Transmit FIFO Underflow Request Enable\n Enables the TFUF flag in the SR to generate an interrupt request

field.name: EOQF_RE
field.description: DSPI Finished Request Enable\n Enables the EOQF flag in the SR to generate an interrupt request

field.name: TCF_RE
field.description: Transmission Complete Request Enable\n Enables TCF flag in the SR to generate an interrupt request

register.name: PUSHR
register.description: PUSH TX FIFO Register In Master Mode

field.name: TXDATA
field.description: Transmit Data

field.name: PCS
field.description: Select which PCS signals are to be asserted for the transfer

field.name: CTCNT
field.description: Clear Transfer Counter

field.name: EOQ
field.description: End Of Queue\n Indicates if this data is the last in this transmission

field.name: CTAS
field.description: Clock and Transfer Attributes Select

field.name: CONT
field.description: Continuous Peripheral Chip Select Enable\n Determines if PCS remains asserted between transfers

register.name: PUSHR_SLAVE
register.description: PUSH TX FIFO Register In Slave Mode

field.name: TXDATA
field.description: Transmit Data

register.name: PUSHR_DATA
register.description: PUSH TX FIFO Data Only Register In Master Mode, (Some devices only)

field.name: TXDATA
field.description: Transmit Data

register.name: PUSHR_COMMAND
register.description: PUSH TX FIFO Command Register In Master Mode, (Some devices only)

field.name: PCS
field.description: Select which PCS signals are to be asserted for the transfer

field.name: CTCNT
field.description: Clear Transfer Counter

field.name: EOQ
field.description: End Of Queue\n Indicates if this data is the last in this transmission

field.name: CTAS
field.description: Clock and Transfer Attributes Select

field.name: CONT
field.description: Continuous Peripheral Chip Select Enable\n Determines if PCS remains asserted between transfers

field.name: RXDATA
field.description: Received Data

field.name: TXDATA
field.description: Transmit Data

field.name: TXCMD_TXDATA
field.description: Transmit Command or Transmit Data

field.name: RXDATA
field.description: Receive Data
